description: The value "unknown zone" was provided for an availability zone. It should be the ID for the zone in which the instance is launched. Here's the wire info: GET /services/Cloud/?AWSAccessKeyId=b424c751-213d-4876-b5f4-2e9f7e0ca2fe%3Astormcloudx4&Action=RunInstances&ImageId=ami-4436fbd1&InstanceType=m1.small&MaxCount=1&MinCount=1&Placement.Availabilit yZone=nova&SignatureMethod=HmacSHA256&SignatureVersion=2&Timestamp=2011-08-09T19%3A08%3A53&Version=2009-11-30&Signature=Lf9NnGw5Zz8GERZO9PFYeyyDG1vrYWzO74zaV8wjezk%3D User-agent: Dasein Cloud Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded; charset=utf-8 HTTP/1.1 200 OK Content-Type: text/xml Content-Length: 816 Date: Tue, 09 Aug 2011 19:08:54 GMT EXMJG4U9CYZREWISGKQRstormcloudx4defaultr-i0ihpwypServer 5None (stormcloudx4, None)i-000000050schedulingami-4436fbd12011-08-09T19:08:54Zunknown zone0m1.small
title: EC2 API: Improper Response from RunInstances

comments.content: The value "unknown zone" was provided for an availability zone. It should be the ID for the zone in which the instance is launched. Here's the wire info: GET /services/Cloud/?AWSAccessKeyId=b424c751-213d-4876-b5f4-2e9f7e0ca2fe%3Astormcloudx4&Action=RunInstances&ImageId=ami-4436fbd1&InstanceType=m1.small&MaxCount=1&MinCount=1&Placement.Availabilit yZone=nova&SignatureMethod=HmacSHA256&SignatureVersion=2&Timestamp=2011-08-09T19%3A08%3A53&Version=2009-11-30&Signature=Lf9NnGw5Zz8GERZO9PFYeyyDG1vrYWzO74zaV8wjezk%3D User-agent: Dasein Cloud Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded; charset=utf-8 HTTP/1.1 200 OK Content-Type: text/xml Content-Length: 816 Date: Tue, 09 Aug 2011 19:08:54 GMT EXMJG4U9CYZREWISGKQRstormcloudx4defaultr-i0ihpwypServer 5None (stormcloudx4, None)i-000000050schedulingami-4436fbd12011-08-09T19:08:54Zunknown zone0m1.small
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~george-reese

comments.content: This is how we gracefully handle an inability to determine which zone the instance resides within.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~bcwaldon

comments.content: And the point of having an EC2 compatible API if you aren't going to be EC2-compatible is what?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~george-reese

comments.content:
'unknown zone' points to a misconfiguration or failure to fetch running services. Would you rather we fail the request? I feel like this is the best way to handle this situation, as it is absolutely compatible with the EC2 spec.

And the primary reason we have our implementation of the EC2 API is to make it easy to transition onto Nova without having to immediately reintegrate with the OpenStack Compute API.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~bcwaldon

comments.content:
It's absolutely not compatible EC2 and your rationale for an EC2 API is a very Rackspace-centric view of the API.

#1 The response above is NEVER encountered in the context of any EC2 or EC2-compatible environment.
#2 It was not in the context of a misconfiguration. You had a VM launched in a zone and the zone became available later.
#3 The EC2 API has a rich ecosystem of tools and actually evolves unlike the OpenStack Compute API, which is just a euphemism for the Rackspace API. THATs why people want it.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~george-reese

comments.content: Thank you very much for your input, and if you would like to submit a patch for this specific bug, we would love to see it. Have a great day!
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~bcwaldon

comments.content:
George,

can you provide more details on how to recreate the problem?
